name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION v. CHESTER-UPLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT SPECIAL BOARD OF CONTROL, Michael F.X. Gillin, B. Granville Lash, and Adriene M. Irving. Appeal of Chester-Upland School District Special Board of Control, Michael F.X. Gillin and Adriene M, Irving
name_abbreviation: Commonwealth, Department of Education v. Chester-Upland School District Special Board of Control

pin_cites.parenthetical: holding quashal is appropriate when entity was "out of existence"
holding quashal is appropriate when entity was "out of existence"

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION v. CHESTER-UPLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT SPECIAL BOARD OF CONTROL, Michael F.X. Gillin, B. Granville Lash, and Adriene M. Irving. Appeal of Chester-Upland School District Special Board of Control, Michael F.X. Gillin and Adriene M, Irving.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 27th day of December, 2007, the appeals at 111 & 115 MAP 2006 are hereby QUASHED, This court’s affirmance of the Commonwealth Court’s order dated April 16, 2007 by opinion and Order at Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Dep’t of Education v. Chester-Upland Special Board of Control et al., — Pa.-, 938 A.2d 1000 (2007), granting the Department of Education’s Application to Substitute Parties has the effect of substituting the Empowerment Board of Control of the Chester-Upland School District for the Special Board of Control of the Chester-Upland School District. Therefore, the Special Board of Control of the Chester-Upland School District is no longer a party to this appeal. See, e.g., Blackwell v. Commonwealth, State Ethics Comm’n, 523 Pa. 347, 567 A.2d 630 (1989) (holding quashal is appropriate when entity was “out of existence”).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
939 A.2d 324
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION v. CHESTER-UPLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT SPECIAL BOARD OF CONTROL, Michael F.X. Gillin, B. Granville Lash, and Adriene M. Irving. Appeal of Chester-Upland School District Special Board of Control, Michael F.X. Gillin and Adriene M, Irving.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Dec. 27, 2007.
